name: Rakshasa
description: The Rakshasa has the body of a human and the head of a tiger, often exhibiting reversed hands. It possesses a strong presence and an agile figure.
memorable: Rakshasas are notable for their illusion and manipulation abilities, making them formidable foes who prefer cunning over brute strength.
goals: Rakshasas often aim to control and manipulate others for personal gain, using their magical and deceptive skills.
relations: Rakshasas may associate with other fiends or serve darker powers, often deceiving mortals to achieve their aims.
environment: Rakshasas commonly infiltrate mortal societies, often posing as nobles or wealthy merchants.
strengths: They have innate spellcasting abilities, access to powerful spells, and a significant resilience against nonmagical attacks.
weaknesses: Rakshasas are particularly vulnerable to piercing damage from magic weapons wielded by good creatures.
attacks: They can perform multiattacks using claws or a rapier, inflicting slashing and piercing damage, and may curse targets.
most_powerful_ability: Their ability to charm and stun targets through Sweet Promises can significantly hinder opponents in combat.
senses: The Rakshasa has truesight up to 60 feet, allowing it to see through illusions and invisibility.
skills: It is highly skilled in deception and insight, making it adept at manipulating social interactions.
additional_information: Capable of shapeshifting into Medium or Small humanoids.
Has Limited Magic Immunity against spells of 6th level or lower.
Can cast a variety of spells at will, enhancing its deceptive capabilities.
Possesses the ability to fly, enabling tactical advantages in movement.
Uses charming gaze for additional control over opponents.
spellcasting: Innate spellcaster; can cast spells like detect thoughts, charm person, and major image.
test_queries: fiend with a tiger head and illusions
powerful illusionist posing as a merchant
